name: [SiC]
description:
[SiC] is an action packed Top Down Shooter complete with blood, gibs, guns, secrets, monsters, crazed space cultists, lore, and so much more. Take on the role of MacKenzie Long, a journalist sent to Tuatha Station to investigate a strange incident. The Station expects you to dodge, shoot and explore your way through it's halls, but can you do it? Can you survive the Tuatha Incident?

- Old School Run n' Gun Action. Defeat enemies with swift sidesteps and a plasma blast to the chest, not squatting behind a rock and capping ankles.

- A bunch of guns. Rifles, Pistols, Shotguns, Machine Guns, Blood Blasters Rockets. The whole nine yards.

- Lots of squishy baddies to blast! From scurrying robotic scavengers to crazed space cultists and even hive minded alien plants there's no shortage of carnage.

-Full Controller Support! Lean back and enjoy the action from the comfort of your couch or favorite recliner.

- 30 levels. Filled with spurts of action, exploration, and space baddies.

- Secrets! In an expansive station like Tuatha there's bound to be secrets and lies to uncover.

- Engage with as much or as little of the story as you like. Just want to shoot stuff? Want to unravel the tale of Tuatha Station? Either approach is entirely valid.

-Experience the odd journey down into the bowels of Tuatha Station and witness somewhere not entirely normal. Is it madness? Is Tuatha Station tearing at the very fabric of reality? There's only one way out, and it's digging straight through.

-Support Alaskan Indiependent Game Development! SiC was designed and developed almost entirely by Alaskan residents, every pixel, every line of code, every music track, and almost every sound effect was created and implemented right here in the frozen 49th state.*

[SiC] was designed, programmed, and drawn by Wyatt White. You can check out some of the other stuff he did/does do on his website or just follow his Twitter feed.

[SiC] features sound design by John Wood.

[SiC] features music by Michael White, you can find other things he works on at his BandCamp or follow him on Twitter.

Additional art assets for [SiC] were drawn by Biomatter, you can follow him on Twitter, but he doesn't tweet much. He's very private.

*Our lovely contributor of sound design John Wood is not based in Alaska

HEY! You can also help us make the next game, Bunker Buster! Check out the Patreon!

Get the soundtrack on Band Camp!!

Any issues or inquiries can be directed here.
